reviewText: This is probably the best Putt-Putt game along with Saves the Zoo. It has a bigger and more fun cast of characters than most of the Putt-Putt games and there's a bit more problem solving. It's still a very easy 45 minute game for children, but in terms of reliving your early youth, this is one of the ones to pick up.

reviewText: During the late 90’s/early 2000’s Humongous Entertainment released an absolutely fantastic stream of “edutainment” point and click adventures for children. These titles focus on a range of light academics including basic geography, basic to upper elementary level mathematics, logical thinking, critical thinking and puzzle solving, topped off with reinforcement of good manners and polite social etiquette. At the lower end of the age spectrum, they may require some adult supervision and supportive guidance, but there is no better series of games for a child’s first venture into PC gaming.\n\nPutt-Putt Joins the Circus didn’t really stick in my memory like the other titles. Much like Putt-Putt Enters the Race, I was beginning to grow out of these games and I think that is mostly to blame. The Circus is certainly not the best title in the series but it’s definitely better than the Race.

reviewText: An Instant Childhood Point-and-Click Classic from the Days of my Childhood, which consist of the old MS-DOS, Windows 3.1, Windows 95, Windows 98 & Windows 98SE PCs. Another Personal Favorite game of mine in which you help Putt-Putt get BJ Sweeny's Big Top Circus Ready for its' Opening Night by saving the circus' 5 Main Acts: Honko the Clown, The Flying Porkowskis: (Herb, Pearl and Hammy), Phillipe the Flea, Reginald Cornelius Andronocles III the Lion, along with two tiger sisters, Terri and Marie, & Katie Cannonball; and all the Minor Acts: Marvin the Marvelous, Eunice the Unicycle, Francine the Hippo High Diver, Ivan the Semi Strong Van, Sebastian the Jugging Seal, and Belobrodnik the Dancing Bear.\n\nThis Fantasic game is sure to curl up your hairy tailtops & put a Spinning Smile on both your tires & faces. This game is also the Last Putt-Putt Title to use the SCUMM (Script Creation Utility for Maniac Mansion) Engine.

reviewText: I thought I hadn't played this one but I'm suuuure I had hnng. Surprise nostalgia. This one doesn't have much randomization to speak of in the slightest but makes up for it with a longer runtime than average, though the puzzles aren't particularly more difficult (they might actually be easier than ever before, really.) Plenty of diverse characters on display too and a pretty decent setting. I found it fun enough, perhaps my favorite of all the humongous games I've been playing recently, so~

reviewText: I had played some of the other Putt-Putt games as a child, such as Joins the Parade, Saves the Zoo and Travels through time. This plays the same as any other Humongous Entertainment, around an hour worth of game play depending on the randomization of the game's puzzles. Or at least thats true for Saves the Zoo and Travels through Time, where items needed or where you can find certain things is different between play throughs.
